DOC.brief_title: Massage Therapy Given Caregiver Treating Quality Life Young Patients Undergoing Treatment Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To determine feasibility acceptability conduct massage intervention childhood cancer patient primary caregiver . II . To investigate feasibility implement brief target massage train protocol caregiver . III . To identify barrier recruitment , intervention adherence , full study completion consent family . IV . To assess preliminary effectiveness massage intervention reduce caregiver child psychological distress ( anxiety , depression , parent stress ) promote child health-related quality life . V. To compare outcome data two intervention arm ( TOUCH : child massage ; TOUCH+ : Caregiver massage plus child massage ) arm wait list control condition . VI . To utilize pilot data development contextually specific target grant application fully power randomize control trial efficacy caregiver massage child undergo treatment cancer . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To investigate reciprocal change self-reported psychosocial functioning within caregiver-child dyad baseline post-intervention . II . To assess impact massage intervention upon level stress biomarker ( cortisol ) caregiver child assess association cortisol level self-reported psychosocial functioning . OUTLINE : Patients caregiver randomize 1 3 treatment arm . ARM I ( WAITLIST CONTROL GROUP ) : Patients caregiver receive standard care offer massage intervention 8 week . ARM II ( TOUCH ) : Caregivers undergo 60-minute training session simple massage technique , include `` Massage Toolkit , '' comprise Swedish Massage Trigger Point Therapy Massage , week 0 booster 60-minute massage training session week 4 licensed massage therapist . Caregivers instruct massage child least 3 20-minute session per week 8 week . ARM III ( TOUCH+ ) : Caregivers undergo 60-minute training session simple massage technique , include `` Massage Toolkit , '' comprise Swedish Massage Trigger Point Therapy Massage , week 0 booster 60-minute massage training session week 4 licensed massage therapist . Caregivers instruct massage child least 3 20-minute session per week 8 week . Caregivers also receive 45-minute massage massage therapist . Patients complete questionnaire week 0 , 8 , 16 . After completion study treatment , patient caregiver follow 8 week .
